intro: Taraxacum krameriense, commonly known as the Krameriense dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces a distinctive white, fluffy seed head that aids in wind dispersal. Taraxacum krameriense is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
